body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kenty.

Your Petitioner Lewis Rose a citizen of Louisville Ky will respectfully state that about four weeks ago one Wilson Maples. a neighbor had been in the habit of leading ^a^ PlowHorse on Petitioners sidewalk & on the day of the difficulty hereinafter stated said Maples was in the act of again leading his horse on the sidewalk of Petitioner when he stoped him & some angry words passed when your Petitioner who had a verry small cane in his hand not larger than his finger struck said Maples one blow. Inflicting no Injury whatever. & your Petitioner then left to go to the & was followed by Maples who had a pistol & was prevented by the bystander from shooting Petitioner

Your Petitioner will further state that said Maples went before the Grand Jury of the City Court & they returned an Indictment against Petitioner for the assault above stated your Petitioner being Ignorant in Law Matters & Supposing that Maples Hi himself had a right to settle the matter. he applyed to him & it was agreed that upon Petitioner paying the costs which he agreed to do. the suit should be
dismissed Your Petitioner believing the matter was settled gave no further attention to this matter & was surprised this week to learn that the case had been tried at the present September Term of the city court and a fine assessed against him of Sixty Dollars & costs.

Your Petitioner has set forth Truly all the facts & circumstances & he again states that no Injury was done to said Maples & that no Tumult or disorder was occasioned thereby & that he was deceived into a beleif that the whole matter was settled Otherwise he would have defended the case. Your Petitioner is a Laborer in the ship yard & supports his family -- a wife & Two orphan Grand children by his daily labor & has no other means of support. He prays your Excellency to remit said Fine of $60. & he in duty bound will &c

The undersigned Neighbors of Lewis Rose & well acquainted with him unite in the request that the fine of $60 assessed against him in the City Court be remitted. He is a man of Truth. an Industrious good Citizen quiet & Peaceable. a poor man who supports a wife & Two Grand children by his daily Labor.

Wm Irwin
M Shoder
Jas T Lee
M Woods Ferguson
Wm. W. Martin
John Gay
Thos. Clarke
A Gilmore
Robt W Hays
☞ The above are owners of saw mills on the river -- with whom Rose has worked as a laborer.
I unite in the petition for release of fine

J B Kinkaid
Wm F Barret
I have examined & inquired into the facts in this case -- I think it highly worthy of executive clemency: The man is poor innocent of any wrong intent --

Louisville City Ct
vs
Lewis Rose
$60,
Assault
Remitted 4th Nov/65
